alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Bullock; Elmore; Lowndes; Montgomery; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 9:12PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pike, Autauga, Elmore, southeastern Chilton, southwestern Bullock, eastern Lowndes and Montgomery Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 912 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Equality to Montgomery to near Shopton. Movement was west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Montgomery, Prattville, Millbrook, Wetumpka, Fort Deposit, Hayneville, Meadville, Pike Road, Elmore, Coosada, Deatsville, Autaugaville, White Hall, Lowndesboro, Hyundai Motors Of Alabama, Santuck, Auburn University In Montgomery, Dublin, Autauga County Airport and Titus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central, south central, southeastern and east central Alabama.

area.areaDesc: Autauga; Bullock; Elmore; Lowndes; Montgomery; Pike
